intro: Matourea pratensis, commonly known as the meadow matourea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
